channel.title: Blog on DWH Academy Posts
channel.description: Recent content in Blog on DWH Academy Posts

item.title: Entropy of the DWH systems
item.description: Increasing entropy defines the direction of time in our Universe. It grows from simple to complex, from ordered to unordered. Even though the entropy can decrease locally, the global increase of Universe’s entropy is irreversible. That’s why entropy is called an arrow of time. Entropy is usually described as a measure of disorder in a closed system. The concept itself is in our world so obvious that we don’t even think about it.

item.title: Proven DWH Design
item.description: There is an unlimited number of ways how to build a data warehouse. Few of them work and some of the few can even survive in the long term. In this post, we are going to describe the high-level design of the typical successful DWH in the long term. Landing Area Imagine the Landing Area as an address, where the files from the source systems arrive. It is the first interface of the DWH, usually some file system organized into directories for each source file.

item.title: About
item.description: Written in Go, Hugo is an open source static site generator available under the Apache Licence 2.0. Hugo supports TOML, YAML and JSON data file types, Markdown and HTML content files and uses shortcodes to add rich content. Other notable features are taxonomies, multilingual mode, image processing, custom output formats, HTML/CSS/JS minification and support for Sass SCSS workflows. Hugo makes use of a variety of open source projects including: https://github.
